events.title: Rosa Parks' Bus Boycott
events.description: Rosa Parks was arrested in Montgomery, Alabama, for refusing to give up her bus seat to a white person, sparking the Montgomery Bus Boycott, a pivotal event in the Civil Rights Movement.
events.significance: This act of defiance became a symbol of the struggle against racial segregation and led to a successful Supreme Court ruling declaring bus segregation unconstitutional.

events.title: Poland Regains Independence
events.description: Poland officially regained independence after 123 years of partitions by Austria-Hungary, Germany, and Russia.
events.significance: This marked the rebirth of Poland as a sovereign nation-state following World War I, profoundly impacting European geopolitics.

events.title: Benazir Bhutto Becomes Prime Minister of Pakistan
events.description: Benazir Bhutto took office as the Prime Minister of Pakistan, becoming the first woman to head a democratic government in a Muslim-majority country.
events.significance: Her election was a groundbreaking moment for gender and political progress in the Muslim world.

events.title: Guinea Declares Independence from France
events.description: Guinea became the first French African colony to gain independence, breaking away from colonial rule.
events.significance: This event inspired other African nations to pursue independence and marked a significant step in African decolonization.

events.title: Same-Sex Marriage Legalized in England and Wales
events.description: Same-sex marriage became legal in England and Wales following the implementation of the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
events.significance: This legalization was a major milestone in the advancement of LGBTQ+ rights in the United Kingdom.
